bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. bringing forth exhaustion-consumption. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 23: 人有觸值死屍，或 臨屍，其屍氣入腹內，與屍蟲相接成病 , “When someone touches a corpse,or is near a corpse, the corpse qi enters his abdomen where it encounters corpse bugs/worms to generate disease”.

② Pathological Condition resulting from inhaling corpse qi, with the corpse qi reaching heart and abdomen where it generates a piercing pain as well as distension and a feeling of fullness, accompanied by qi urgency. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 23: 其發亦心腹刺痛，脹滿氣 急。但聞屍氣則發，故謂之屍氣 , “When it breaks out, [patients] feel a piercing pain in the heart and abdomen, with distension, a feeling of fullness and qi urgency. One only needs to inhale corpse qi and it will break out. Hence it is called ‘ corpse qi ’”. ③ The stench emitted by a rotting corpse. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry bao yu 鮑魚 quoting Xin xiu ben cao 新修本草 : 鮑似屍臭 , “ Bao -fish stinks like a corpse”, writes: 彌臭似屍氣 , “Its stench resembles that of corpse qi ”.
